thread.title: Ethiopia: Ethio-Telecom, Office Sign 8100 a SMS Service Accord
thread.title_full: Ethiopia: Ethio-Telecom, Office Sign 8100 a SMS Service Accord

title: Ethiopia: Ethio-Telecom, Office Sign 8100 a SMS Service Accord
text:
By Robel Yohannes 
The involvement of entities like ethio-telecom guarantees the successful completion of the project. 
Ethio-telecom and National Council for the Coordination of Public Participation for the Construction of the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam (GERD) yesterday signed an agreement providing for facilitating the second round 8100 A SMS service to raise funds for the construction of the am. The former has contributed 33,385,994 Birr in the first round SMS service. 
Signing the agreement on behalf of ethio-telecom, CEO Andualem Admassie said that the company will contribute 40 per cent and 100 per cent proceeds from the mobile lottery and the service rendered respectively to support GERD. 
He added that the Auto Replay Message service will be given for free by the telecom company. Furthermore, the CEO said that the company is planning the third round bond purchase for the Dam worth 31,425,634 Birr. 
According to Andualem, ethio-telecom has contributed over 33 million Birr from the first round of 8100 A SMS service, which is pooled from gifts of 364 mobile accessories and 364,000 Birr worth mobile cards along with 40 per cent of the proceeds from the SMS service. 
He also noted that the company has given more than 61 million Birr in bond purchase from the previous two rounds. Andualem concluded his statement saying that the company will carry out its institutional, national and social responsibilities, and continue providing support for the project until its completion. 
Office Deputy Director General Zadig Abraha on the occasion said that ethio-telecom is one of the grand institutions that shoulder huge responsibility towards realizing the renaissance of the country. Lauding the company's contribution so far, Zadig said that the involvement of entities like ethio-telecom guarantees the successful completion of the project. 
On the occasion, the company handed over mobile accessories and 13,000 music CD copies sponsored by ethio-telecom. It was also learnt that the service charge for 8100 A SMS, scheduled to be launched next week, will remain the same. Ethiopia
